description: Gets information about a specific import.

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the import to describe.

nested_items.name: importId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the described import.

nested_items.name: resourceSpecification
nested_items.description: The specifications of the imported bot, bot locale, or custom vocabulary.

nested_items.name: botImportSpecification
nested_items.description: Parameters for importing a bot.

nested_items.name: botName
nested_items.description: The name that Amazon Lex should use for the bot.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to build and run the bot.

nested_items.name: dataPrivacy
nested_items.description: By default, data stored by Amazon Lex is encrypted. The DataPrivacy structure provides settings that determine how Amazon Lex handles special cases of securing the data for your bot.

nested_items.name: childDirected
nested_items.description: For each Amazon Lex bot created with the Amazon Lex Model Building Service, you must specify whether your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) by specifying true or false in the childDirected field. By specifying true in the childDirected field, you confirm that your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. By specifying false in the childDirected field, you confirm that your use of Amazon Lex is not related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. You may not specify a default value for the childDirected field that does not accurately reflect whether your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. If your use of Amazon Lex relates to a website, program, or other application that is directed in whole or in part, to children under age 13, you must obtain any required verifiable parental consent under COPPA. For information regarding the use of Amazon Lex in connection with websites, programs, or other applications that are directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13, see the Amazon Lex FAQ.

nested_items.name: errorLogSettings
nested_items.description: Allows you to configure destinations where error logs will be published during the bot import process.

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: Settings parameters for the error logs, when it is enabled.

nested_items.name: idleSessionTTLInSeconds
nested_items.description: The time, in seconds, that Amazon Lex should keep information about a user's conversation with the bot.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: testBotAliasTags
nested_items.description: A list of tags to add to the test alias for a bot. You can only add tags when you import a bot. You can't use the UpdateAlias operation to update tags. To update tags on the test alias, use the TagResource operation.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: botLocaleImportSpecification
nested_items.description: Parameters for importing a bot locale.

nested_items.name: botId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the bot to import the locale to.

nested_items.name: botVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the bot to import the locale to. This can only be the DRAFT version of the bot.

nested_items.name: localeId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the language and locale that the bot will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the intents, slot types, and slots used in the bot must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

nested_items.name: nluIntentConfidenceThreshold
nested_items.description: Determines the threshold where Amazon Lex will insert the AMAZON.FallbackIntent, AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent, or both when returning alternative intents. AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent are only inserted if they are configured for the bot.
AMAZON.FallbackIntent.
IntentA.
IntentB.
IntentC.

nested_items.name: voiceSettings
nested_items.description: Defines settings for using an Amazon Polly voice to communicate with a user.
standard.
neural.
long-form.
generative.

nested_items.name: customVocabularyImportSpecification
nested_items.description: Provides the parameters required for importing a custom vocabulary.

nested_items.name: botId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the bot to import the custom vocabulary to.

nested_items.name: botVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the bot to import the custom vocabulary to.

nested_items.name: localeId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the local to import the custom vocabulary to. The value must be en_GB.

nested_items.name: testSetImportResourceSpecification
nested_items.description: Specifications for the test set that is imported.

nested_items.name: testSetName
nested_items.description: The name of the test set.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the test set.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that has permission to access the test set.

nested_items.name: storageLocation
nested_items.description: Contains information about the location that Amazon Lex uses to store the test-set.

nested_items.name: s3BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket in which the test set is stored.

nested_items.name: s3Path
nested_items.description: The path inside the Amazon S3 bucket where the test set is stored.

nested_items.name: kmsKeyArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS) key for encrypting the test set.

nested_items.name: importInputLocation
nested_items.description: Contains information about the input location from where test-set should be imported.

nested_items.name: s3BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: s3Path
nested_items.description: The path inside the Amazon S3 bucket pointing to the test-set CSV file.

nested_items.name: modality
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the test-set being imported contains written or spoken data.

nested_items.name: testSetTags
nested_items.description: A list of tags to add to the test set. You can only add tags when you import/generate a new test set. You can't use the UpdateTestSet operation to update tags. To update tags, use the TagResource operation.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: importedResourceId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier that Amazon Lex assigned to the resource created by the import.

nested_items.name: importedResourceName
nested_items.description: The name of the imported resource.

nested_items.name: mergeStrategy
nested_items.description: The strategy used when there was a name conflict between the imported resource and an existing resource. When the merge strategy is FailOnConflict existing resources are not overwritten and the import fails.

nested_items.name: importStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the import process. When the status is Completed the resource is imported and ready for use.

nested_items.name: failureReasons
nested_items.description: If the importStatus field is Failed, this provides one or more reasons for the failure.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: creationDateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the import was created.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedDateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the import was last updated.
